title: Drawing, Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago International Exposition; Elevations, 1933
title_raw: Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago International Exposition; Elevations
medium: Graphite, orange color pencil, and green color pencil on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
markings: Office stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with dimensions, instructions throughout Inscribed in graphite in architect's stamp: 1/2"=1'; E.W. / D.D. / 3/23/33;
description: Elevations and placement plan for living room in Central Station Industry Exhibit, Century of Progress Chicago International Exposition. Placement plan at center show arrangement of furniture throughout living room. Indication of placement of paintings and sculpture: Left wall above sofa is Fiene picture; on cabinet in upper left corner is John Storrs sculpture; over bookshelves is Reuben Nakian seal sculpture; above piano prints by Spencer (?) and Louis Lozowick (?); above cabinet in upper right corner is William Zorach head and Follet (?) painting. Sections of room showing detailed drawings throughout perimeter of design. Upper left corner shows upper wall elevation. Radio on left with circular speaker on outside surface. At right is low, three-shelf open bookcase, window above. Two upholstered armchairs separated by low, round side table in front of bookshelves. Low red leather bench in front of piano with floor lamp to left of bench. Upholstered armchair and red leather, low sidechair in front of piano. Two prints on wall above piano. Upper right corner shows right wall elevation with low round side table at left, red upholstered low sidechair facing table. Rounded desk behind chair, with red upholstered armchair. Similar red upholstered armchair to right. Expansive windows from floor to ceiling on right wall, with column towards left. Elevation on right shows another view of furniture on right wall, including cabinet, sculpture and painting at left. Elevation at left shows door on left, three-seat sofa at center with small, rectangular side table to left of sofa. Painting or print above sofa. Cabinet or radio to right of sofa, window above. Sculpture above radio or cabinet.
